Résumé

 Professional Experience 

 Freelance Reporter, Paid Speaker, and Industry Analyst, (11/2025 - present) 
• Undertake and complete investigative projects and other enterprise journalism for regional and national news organizations
• As an expert panelist, present on the demographic, societal, and technological challenges ahead for public research universities across the next 25 years
• Draft white paper entitled "Generational Change: Public Research Universities and the Next Quarter-Century (2026-2050)"

  Senior Reporter – The Chronicle of Higher Education, (11/2021 - 10/2025) 
 Staff Reporter – (01/2018 - 10/2021) 
• Pitch and produce original breaking-news content, medium-term enterprise analyses, and long-term investigative projects
• Spearhead and collaborate on FOIA and open-records requests, as well as on data-driven and agenda-setting projects
• Code and deploy a suite of free or low-cost reporting and data-collection assets

  Data Reporter – The Chronicle of Higher Education, (04/2016 – 12/2017) 
• Collect, clean, analyze, and lead the publication of The Chronicle’s semiannual chief executive compensation projects
• Pitch and produce data-driven articles, and collaborate with reporters

  Data Reporter – The Saint Paul Pioneer Press, (02/2015 – 04/2016) 
• Produce data-driven stories and online interactive features
• Assist reporters in learning data skills or applying them to their beats
• Maintain and build in-house databases for reporters and editors, plus an online data repository for the public

  Fellow – The Medill Justice Project, (09/2014 – 12/2014) 
• Continually update MJP’s comprehensive database of shaken baby cases
• Analyze and interpret trends within the data

  Finance & Policy Intern – The Chronicle of Higher Education, (06/2014 – 08/2014) 
• Cover news affecting higher education nationally, specifically related to government policy, institutional finance and budgetary trends in academe
• Produce special reports and craft one-of-a-kind databases
• Create multimedia complements

  Investigative/News Producer Intern – KMOV-TV, (01/2014 – 05/2014) 
• Submit and track government information requests
• Produce pieces for newscasts and special projects
• Write scripts for the primetime newscast and web
• Coordinate coverage of election results for the Illinois Primary (3/18/14) and Missouri municipal elections (4/8/14)

  Senior Editor – The Journal at Webster Univ., (05/2013 – 05/2014) 
• Oversee and report on long-term investigative projects
• Produce pieces for newscasts and special projects
• Manage a small group of reporters, providing advice and support
• Seek out multimedia storytelling options to enhance our reporting

  Freelance Reporter – The Saint Louis Business Journal, (05/2013 – 08/2013) 
• Cover trade trends and business growth in the St. Louis region
• Topics included healthcare, trade with China and saving for retirement

  News Editor – The Journal at Webster Univ., (05/2012 – 05/2013) 
• Manage and advise a staff of a dozen student journalists
• Assign stories, edit copy and layout the news section of the weekly paper
• Develop and encourage multimedia stories for news
• Facilitate a "public records" state of mind in the newsroom

  Staff Reporter – The Journal at Webster Univ., (07/2011 – 01/2012) 
• Develop my reporting skills while covering the courts and breaking news

  Programming Languages 

• Python, using NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Beautiful Soup, Flask, GeoPandas, tabula, PDFPlumber
 • JavaScript, using  Apps Script, D3.js, Leaflet.js, Node.js, Playwright, Highcharts JS, jQuery, RawGraphs, React, Preact, TypeScript, Vue
 • R, using tidyverse, ggplot2, caret, keras
 • Bash & command-line tools, such as csvkit
 • Structured Query Language
 • Regex / Regular Expression
 • AppleScript
 • Ruby
